channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How old is your music taste? Spotify will tell you, though you may not like it
item.description: Spotify Wrapped is bluntly telling users their "listening age," which in many cases is several decades older or younger than their actual age. It's a ...

item.title: DOJ orders prison inspectors to stop considering LGBTQ safety standards
item.description: A memo obtained by NPR shows the Justice Department is telling inspectors to stop evaluating prisons using standards designed to protect trans and oth...

item.title: U.S. reconsiders Tanzania ties after deadly post-election crackdown
item.description: The U.S. is "comprehensively reviewing" its relationship with Tanzania after hundreds were killed in a violent post-election crackdown.

item.title: CDC advisers delay planned vote on hepatitis B vaccine for infants
item.description: After a contentious discussion, the vaccine advisory group pushed the vote to Friday to give members time to study the language of proposed changes lo...

item.title: Libraries and museums get federal funding back after Trump cuts
item.description: Earlier this year, the Trump administration gutted the Institute of Museum and Library Services, leading to canceled federal grants. Now, after a cour...

item.title: Israel strikes south Lebanon after first direct talks in decades
item.description: The Israeli military says it struck Hezbollah sites, less than 24 hours after Israel and Lebanon sent civilian envoys to meet.

item.title: Are there free credit card debt relief options available now?
item.description: Some credit card relief strategies cost nothing upfront, but they aren't always the most effective options.

item.title: U.S. tightens immigration work permits in latest move to expand crackdown
item.description: The Trump administration said it would reduce the period of time that work permits are valid for refugees, asylees and other immigrants granted legal ...

item.title: Trump hosts signing of peace deal between leaders of DR Congo and Rwanda
item.description: The US president hopes that a peace deal will pave the way for greater American investment in the resource-rich region.

item.title: Putin says Russia will take Donbas by force or Ukraine's troops will withdraw
item.description: The Russian leader's comments come as US and Ukrainian negotiators are due to hold a new round of talks.

item.title: Employers have cut 1.1 million jobs this year. Here's why.
item.description: Job cuts so far this year are at their highest levels since 2020, new report says.

item.title: A county jail in Arkansas produces hundreds of ICE arrests under a program surging across the US
Suspect arrested in pipe bomb incident on eve of Jan 6, ending years-long manhunt
item.description: The bombs were placed the night before the 6 January riots, and were discovered as rioters began to storm the Capitol.

item.title: Immigration crackdown in New Orleans has a target of 5,000 arrests. Is that possible?
FBI arrests suspect in 2021 D.C. pipe bomb case, identified as Virginia man
item.description: Authorities say the FBI has arrested a man suspected of placing pipe bombs outside RNC and DNC headquarters on the eve of the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol ri...

item.title: Pentagon watchdog finds Hegseth's Signal chat violated regulations
item.description: The Pentagon watchdog released its report on Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's use of Signal to share details about operations in Yemen.

item.title: Ireland among countries boycotting Eurovision after Israel allowed to compete
item.description: There had been calls for Israel's exclusion over the war in Gaza, as well as unfair voting accusations.

item.title: Man accused of planting pipe bombs before Jan. 6 Capitol attack is charged with explosives offenses
item.description: The FBI has arrested a man accused of placing two pipe bombs outside the headquarters of the Republican and Democratic national parties in Washington ...
